clinical_study.brief_title: Health-care Quality in Semi-intensive Care Units
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation and Improvement of the Health-care Quality in Semi-intensive Care Units

lead_sponsor.agency: Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research

clinical_study.source: Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research

brief_summary.textblock: The main aim of this study is to realize a system of continuous evaluation of healthcare quality in semi-intensive care units.

detailed_description.textblock: Collecting data of semi-intensive care units' patients and structural data of hospitals, healthcare quality's indicators will be realized. Starting from those indicators of insuccess, specific for different kinds of patients, it will be possibile to evaluate the general level of care in each singular semi-intensive care unit. The study will least for 5 years, but at the end of every year it will be realized a report of analysis to see the results of each unit.

primary_outcome.measure: Outcome for stationary patients with high risk of variability
primary_outcome.description: hospitalization in semi-intensive care unit more than 2 days or transfer to intensive care unit

primary_outcome.measure: Outcome for low gravity patients, with a low organ's damage

primary_outcome.description: transfer to intensive care unit or hospital mortality
transfer to intensive care unit or hospital mortality

arm_group.description: All patients admitted in the semi-intensive care units attending the study. Be basing on the average number of patients yearly treated in those units, we expect to have at least 39000 patients during the 5 years of the study.

study_pop.textblock: all patients hospitalised in a semi-intensive care unit attending the study, during a 5 years period of time (from 1st january 2021, to 31st december 2025)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients hospitalised in a semi-intensive care unit
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
